Verified Manager04/16/2015

Thank you for taking the time to review our community. We value and appreciate the feedback of our residents and guests. We are so sorry to hear that your experience was unpleasant.It is very important to us that all of our residents have a comfortable and enjoyable living experience at our community. We understand that everyone has a different tolerance level to apartment noise. In consideration of all involved parties, we takes several steps before taking action related to noise complaints, including speaking to all residents involved. If the problem persists, our courtesy monitor is asked to monitor the noise level and report their findings to us to determine next steps. We have found this strategy to be the fairest approach for all parties involved. If you are still experiencing noise levels that you feel are beyond acceptable limits, please contact our office if it is during business hours, or contact our courtesy monitor if it is after hours so that we may hear what you are experiencing and remedy the situation. Our courtesy monitor is available for all of our residents and may be paged out using the same steps taken to contact our 24 hour emergency maintenance.In regards to the water bill, we do have a billing service that sends out monthly bills, but the rates for water and sewer are set by Durham County. You water bill will reflect the actual usage for hot water and sewer and an average for the building for cold water. Trash and pest control fees are also included in the water bill. Water/Sewer bills are billed in arears so you will not immediately see a decrease in the service cost when travelling or away from home. All bills received reflect service from two months prior. For example, the bill due with April rent is for services during the month of February. If you are still concerned with the accuracy of your bill, we are also happy to inspect the home for any potential maintenance issues that would cause an increase in your monthly bill.Please contact o

Resident
2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/25/2014
When I was looking at these apartments, I was looking for a place close to work. I wanted a location that had amenities close by, but, I did not want to have a place where there are so many tenants. Woods Edge Apartments fit my checklist. I was able to get one of the renovated apartments and since moving in, I have been very happy. Of course if you live on the ground or first floors ( I live on the first floor), you will hear some noise from the tenant above you. However,it is not bad. I love the screened in porch and so do my cats. They are able to sit outside and bask in the sun and watch the birds and squirrels instead of having to stay inside all of the time. I have a laundry room that is big enough to move around in. And while the apartment complex was built in the eighties, it has character. The owners are renovating all of the apartments as tenants move out. I have all new appliances in the kitchen and laundry room as well as new hardware and plumbing in the bathrooms, along with the usual new carpet and paint throughout the apartment. All of the issues I have mentioned to maintenance have been taking care quickly and quietly.

2013 - 2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 03/27/2014
Do not move in here. They will show you the model and when you go to move in, the apartment will look DRASTICALLY different. The cabinets are falling apart. The countertop over the dishwasher is crumbling. The appliances are very old. The refrigerator in my unit had to be replaced because it smelled like something DIED in it. This was apart from the fact it was rusting on the outside. It had to have been over 20 years old. If you live downstairs (which I do but only for a short time thank GOD)...you will hear everything your upstairs neighbors do. This includes using the bathroom. The floors creak with every step your neighbor makes. The pipes squeal loudly when the water is turned on. Every time my neighbor washes a dish, I know it. It causes you to go a little crazy. You will pay for water and sewer. This will cost you between $45-$55 every month. It doesn't matter if you try and conserve. It's useless. Trust me I've tried. There are problems with cockroaches though this is the south and there are wooded areas. The flying ones are particularly nasty. I also had to get my apartment sprayed because it was infested with fleas. I have a cat who is 13 years old and has never had fleas in her life (she is an inside cat). She was eaten up by them. I tend to think the fleas came from the squatters who apparently were making this unit their home for a few weeks before I moved in. I got a call from the office about week before I was supposed to move (from a city 80 miles away). She said that the unit would not be ready until 5 days after my intended move in date. I had to frantically call my moving company, the electric company, etc so I could stay in my place those extra five days. I had to ask for any financial break due to the inconvenience. They took off $100 from one of the random "fees". And I know it was squatters because my nice neighbors told me about it and actually showed me pictures of what these squatters did to the apartment. Amazing. Honestly just amazing. The extra bonus is that when my lease came up for renewal they had upped the base rent over $120/month. For these ratholes. Do yourself a FAVOR and run. Do not waste your money

My boyfriend and I almost moved here, but luckily we escaped before actually signing the lease. We went and visited this apartment complex in early December and fell in love with their model apartment. We were told that we would pay a more expensive rent in order to have their "upgraded" apartments - which sounded fair to me. The upgrade meant we would get all black appliances, track lighting and overall new fixtures. Our move-in date was set for January 16, 2014. This day finally arrives, and we head down to Woods Edge to sign the lease with -------------, the woman who had been helping us the entire time, and then everything fell apart. She pulled out the lease and went through it with us pointing out how "stupid" most of the clauses are, which put me off because I found it rather unprofessional. We explained to her that although everything sounded kosher, we would like to walk-through the apartment that was going to be ours before signing the lease, because we had not previously had the opportunity to do so. Our walk-through proved to be a good decision. There was no track lighting, rotten wood under the kitchen sink, and the handle bars above where the soap goes had fallen completely off in both bathrooms. Not to mention there was weird black spots on all the mirrors, and the place looked absolutely nothing like the model... no where even CLOSE, which in my opinion is false advertising. ------ seems embarrassed and explains she will have it fixed and we can come back the next day and it will be move-in ready. However, first impressions are the most important so we went elsewhere. My last complaint is our holding deposit. Our offer to rent states that it will be refunded if the apartment is not move-in ready by the agreed upon date. Well it turns out that we don't get our $100 deposit back because according to Woods Edge, it was move-in ready and only needed a few minor repairs that would have only inconvenienced us for a day or so.

That was our first inkling that something wasn't right. They came in and we explained to the the concerns for our child because she has bad allergies but they continued to put a industrial fan UNDER the carpet to dry it, then instead of fixing the problem just put some paint over the walls and called it good. Well other than the maintenance issues we enjoined our time there. We moved out in July, under the correct conditions, notice and all. So we to all got the corporate number today so hopefully we can get all this settled. As for the price, it is comparable to other properties in the area but for what is offered $850.00 a month was quiet steep, in my opinion. Resident
2011 - 2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/05/2012
I live with my boyfriend and we are on our second year here. This is the first apartment for both of us, but I love it. I'm in college at UNC still, so I needed an apartment close to campus. We're right on the bus line, so it only takes me 15 minutes to get to school and it's free since I have a GoPass through UNC. Yes, it's a little more expensive now. Yes, they have added a couple fees and the rent has gone up since we've lived here. What apartment doesn't go up over time? The location is great and the apartments are still more reasonable than anywhere else you would actually want to live around here. Durham can be scary, but I've never been concerned in this complex. We even have the cutest kids who ride their bikes around. (I've never lived in a neighborhood before, so this tickles me) The appliances are a little dated, but everything works. The maintenance guys are nice, though I definitely prefer one over the other. The office staff are nice. I don't usually talk to them, but they are always responsive when I get my boyfriend to call and they work to resolve any issues. We had ants, but we got a pack of those little death boxes and they went away. We've had probably 6 or 7 roach sightings in a year and a half, but I scream and the boyfriend takes care of it. We got death boxes for them too. I suppose you might have a bigger issue with bugs if you call maintenance instead of just taking care of it. It's not perfect, but we have a bar in the kitchen, vaulted ceilings, huge closets, a fireplace, and a little sunroom that we use as an office/guest room. We looked at a lot of places before we decided to stay here, and this was the most reasonably priced option we found for exactly what we needed (I'm not willing to pay an extra $50 for crown moulding). Plus, my apartment totally kicks the butt of all my other poor college friends. Edit: While I do believe that you get what you pay for, I have grown increasingly frustrated with our little community. The maintenance staff who don't exactly know what they're doing (We had a problem with our tub faucet falling off which was gross/scary and made showers impossible. They came and replaced it after a few days, but it continued to be a problem and we went two weeks with just baths), plus one of our neighbors has a tendency to yell at her son's father in front of our building while he plays loud music from his car, and while they advertise a 24 fitness center, both treadmills are completely broken now. One since Thanksgiving and the other in January. They've been saying the parts were ordered for months...

Resident
2010 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/06/2010
If you're thinking about moving to Woods Edge Apartments, you may want to reconsider. This is an VERY poorly managed property. The current manager is the most objectionable woman you will ever meet in a public facing position. The management abuses their right to access your living space arbitrarily and without appointment anytime they like which is often. Everything about the apartments is sub-standard. The cabinets are cheap crudely constructed plywood and are in disrepair. The appliances are old and inefficient. My apartment has flooded 3 times since I leased it and last time the manager was less than helpful in resolving the problem. There has been standing water outside my apartment from air conditioning condensation since I moved in. This is a health hazard and the management just sends some flunky with zero level maintenance skill to make some jury rigged repair without actually fixing the problem. The latest issue is that they decided to start charging for water which was previously included in the rent. Unfortunately, the buildings weren't built with each apartment on it's own water meter. Not to be deterred, they came up with a hare-brained scheme to install flow meters on the hot water tanks in each apartment. They then use some half-assed formula to stick you with some portion of the property's water cost. I have no doubt but that this is nothing more than a money grab and they are completely shameless about it. Additionally, they have insisted on entering the apartment half a dozen times to install and check these half-assed flow meters. Every time they insist on violating your space, if you have a dog, you either have to take off from work and be home or you have to confine your dog to a crate for the entire day. I am completely unsatisfied with the apartments and the management and would give them zero stars if possible. In summary, this is probably one of the worst apartment complexes in the Triangle. Do yourself a huge favor and try and find something somewhere else.

Resident
2009 - 2010 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/20/2010
My wife and I moved here from Michigan and thought we were making a good choice but we didn't. The quality of finishes (carpet, vinyl flooring, etc.) were below standard. The kitchen cabinets were old and deteriorating. We had to clean our dishes every time we want to use them after pulling them out of the cupboards. The appliances were old and the refrigerator molded around the edges often. The furnace was so inefficient that our average heat bill during the winter was about $250 per month. The apartment above us flooded and maintenance said they would repaint the damaged ceiling and clean our carpets but never did. The ceiling in the bathroom started to fall down and when maintenance came to fix it they entered our apartment without announcing themselves and started work while my wife was sleep in the house alone. He didn't cover up or protect anything and scraped the ceiling popcorn all over the tub, sink, toilet and whatever we had sitting on the sink then just left (unfinished). My wife had to clean up after him. Several days later when no one came back I called to see what was up, the office staff told me that they just forgot to finish. When we left we asked what we needed to do to clean and the office staff told us not to worry about it, but we cleaned anyways. They charged us $60 for dirty appliances and a small scratch in the vinyl flooring. If you feel like getting ripped off and ignored by the staff then this is the place for you.

2009 Not Recommended Reviewed 02/23/2010
My girlfriend and I lived at Woods Edge for a few months. We have lived together in 4 different apartments and overall this was the worst. We lived on the first floor with an apartment below us and an apartment above us. The walls are paper thin, you could here every movement the people living above us made. The people on the lower level had a dog that would bark all day and night long. I notified management and turns out they weren't suppose to have any animals in that apartment. It took them over a month to finally have the dog removed. We also had a few cats in the building that would run around loose and sit and meow outside my door. (it clearly states in the lease that all animals must be on a leash) I also notified them of the cats many times and to this day I don't think anything was ever done. When we first moved in the manager at the time told us that when the cleaners cleaned the carpets they rolled back the carpets and cleaned the padding as well. Which I have worked in construction for many years and know that is completely untrue. After about a week our feet were turning black from the carpet and there were stains coming out all over the place. We finally got them to replace the carpet. The padding and sub-floor under the carpet was absolutely disgusting. (obviously not cleaned) We also had a drug problem in our building. There were suspicious people coming in and out of one of the apartments all day long. Every once in a while you could smell marijuana smoke in the building. I notified the on site officer a couple of times and even the Durham police and nothing was ever done about the situation. We also some problems with fees we had to pay when we left the apartment. (make sure you read your lease word for word. even though we had been in 4 different apartments and all of them had almost identical leases Woods Edge adds a bunch of fine print.) It seemed as if the only part of the lease agreement that Woods Edge cares about is the ones that make them money. They look the other way when it comes to the things that make your stay at their community safe and enjoyable.

anonymous 02/20/2010

The Woods Edge Management would like to take this opportunity to respond to this posting by our former clients. Woods Edge does have a model apartment home that does include some upgrades. However, due to the maturity of the property there are several upgrades that have been completed throughout the community in most of our apartment homes of which is considered to be standard in our industry. When possible, we encourage our clients to come and view their new apartment home in advance to ensure that they are happy with their decision to become apart of our community. In addition, once management is notified concerning any pest issues inside of an apartment home immediate action is taken to ensure that this is taken care of so that the client is able to enjoy the comforts of their home. We do not have any current reports of problems with any pest at this time. The Woods Edge Management also offers clients a 24 hour on call courtesy officer. We presently have two onsite courtesy officers that often bring their work vehicles home with them and we encourage them to drive the property and to make their presence known onsite. We like the courtesy officers to be visible for our clients and their guests. Although, the management can not predict the behaviors or actions of others we make every attempt to remain informed about the happenings of our property as well as the surrounding communities in the area. We remain in contact on a weekly basis with our local police department and sheriffs department regarding any issues in our neighboring areas an on our community. The Woods Edge Management encourages clients to notify the staff of any problems, issues or concerns that they may have regarding their apartment home, if we are not notified we can not assist a resident and or correct the problem. In regard to our early lease termination policies; we require all of our clients to provide a 60-Day Written Notice to Vacate of which is clearly outlined in the lease agreement that all clients must sign at the time of move-in. In an effort to be proactive The Woods Edge Management provides a written notification to all clients?? 90-Days prior to their lease expiration as a courtesy to allow our clients time to reflect upon their decision to remain or leave the community. Once proper notification is provided to the office we make every effort to work with our clients because we understand that unforeseen circumstances can arise in life. Furthermore, we also offer various options to assist our clients should they have to terminate their lease agreement prematurely. The Woods Edge Staff & Management Company is both professional and personable with their clients because we consider them an extension of the BBR Management Family. Therefore, The Woods Edge Management respectfully disagrees with these former clients comments and while they are entitled to their opinion keep in mind there are always to sides to a story that may not be reflected in their post. We encourage you to give Woods Edge an opportunity to provide you with the superior customer service that we have provided throughout the years. Respectfully Submitted By the Woods Edge Management.

Resident
2008 - 2009 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/10/2009
Woods Edge is a decent place to live. I have certainly heard about worse places! The office staff are friendly, even if they don't always return your calls. The corporate office of Babcock & Brown Residential is equally bad about returning calls, which is kind of annoying. When we first decided to move in, we chose a 1-bedroom, 1-bath on the second floor for around $700. We signed the lease and everything. They called us and said that they didn't have the apartment they promised us available. They offered us a 1-bedroom, 1-bath on the first floor facing the parking lot, which we declined. Since we had already signed the lease, we convinced them to give us a 2-bedroom, 2-bath on the second floor facing the woods for the same rate. It was nice that they were accomodating, but they didn't exactly give us the best impression right off the bat. Thank goodness we'd already signed the lease! They occasionally have appreciation events, but I have never been impressed. Sometimes they cancel them with nonotice so you show up to an empty room- don't expect a lot there. The fitness center is dismal, but it still beats paying for a gym membership at a fancy club. The pool is nice, although it is always full of loud kids (many whom I doubt live in the complex). The maintenance people are friendly and do an adaquet job, although I think the office staff sometimes has issues with communication. For example, when we first moved in I complained that our bathtub drain was clogged and the dishwasher was broken. The fixed the ub and we had to call again about the dishwasher. The apartments have very dated fixtures (I bet most of the kitchens haven't been updated in the 20 years the complex has been around), but they work. No complaints with the neighbors- it seems to consist of a lot of families and young couples who keep to themselves. A few aggressive dogs, but that's probably the fault of their owners, not Woods Edge. No problems with parking. It's nice that it's near a plaza with a grocery store, a bus line and many walking trails- these are some of the best things about Woods Edge! We've lived here for almost 2 years. We didn't move even though our rent spiked exponentially after the first year just because we didn't think the cost of moving would outweigh the annoyance of having to pay more. Honestly, I think every complex has its problems. If you can afford it, go to a complex that's a little swankier or buy your own home! For the money it's decent.
Woods Edge is a decent place to live. I have certainly heard about worse places! The office staff are friendly, even if they don't always return your calls. The corporate office of Babcock & Brown Residential is equally bad about returning calls, which is kind of annoying. When we first decided to move in, we chose a 1-bedroom, 1-bath on the second floor for around $700. We signed the lease and everything. They called us and said that they didn't have the apartment they promised us available. They offered us a 1-bedroom, 1-bath on the first floor facing the parking lot, which we declined. Since we had already signed the lease, we convinced them to give us a 2-bedroom, 2-bath on the second floor facing the woods for the same rate. It was nice that they were accomodating, but they didn't exactly give us the best impression right off the bat. Thank goodness we'd already signed the lease! They occasionally have appreciation events, but I have never been impressed. Sometimes they cancel them with nonotice so you show up to an empty room- don't expect a lot there. The fitness center is dismal, but it still beats paying for a gym membership at a fancy club. The pool is nice, although it is always full of loud kids (many whom I doubt live in the complex). The maintenance people are friendly and do an adaquet job, although I think the office staff sometimes has issues with communication. For example, when we first moved in I complained that our bathtub drain was clogged and the dishwasher was broken. The fixed the ub and we had to call again about the dishwasher. The apartments have very dated fixtures (I bet most of the kitchens haven't been updated in the 20 years the complex has been around), but they work. No complaints with the neighbors- it seems to consist of a lot of families and young couples who keep to themselves. A few aggressive dogs, but that's probably the fault of their owners, not Woods Edge. No problems with parking. I am a 45-yr-old single white professional woman, who lived at Woods Edge for two years while I learned the area and then bought a place. I enjoyed Woods Edge and would highly recommend it. The location is ideal with easy access to I-40, UNC and Duke. I was in a quiet building, backing up to lovely woods, and never had any problems. My neighbors were a diverse and friendly group and I enjoyed getting to know them. I liked being able to borrow DVDs from the office for free. The exercise room is small but it had all I needed to save on by not having to join a gym. There are many nice places to walk. When I left, my security deposit was returned to me - no gouging as I have had at other places where they subtract and tell you there was damage you didn't do.

2004 - 2005 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/23/2006
As a former resident of Woods Edge Apartment, I was very pleased with the place when I moved in. Only a few weeks after moving in the management changed, which at that time I had no problems with. Every complex has its problems and Woods Edge is no exception to these problems. Don't get me wrong it is in a very nice neighborhood (located across the street from a grocery store, retaurants, and within two minutes of a newly constructed mall), but there are some problems. One of the major problems was the trash pickup in the complex. Trash at the dumpster often overflowed which we all know is a health risk. If someone asked the question, <br>"Would you live there again?", my answer would problably be yes. This is simply because of its location. Good high school nearby, Three colleges (University of North Carolina Chapel Hill (5mins), Duke University (6-8mins) and North Carolina Central University 3-4mins), running and hiking trails(which are very nice), and the restaurants and mall. Although many will make it out to be the worst place in the world it is not as bad as they make it seem. In my opinion it is one of those ideal locations for college students with roommates or professional students looking for a convinent location to a library.

The corporation, with management's enthusiastic support, tries to screw you at every legal turn, although on closer inspection, some of this probably isn't legal. Through vague wording in the lease, they leave themselves opportunities to charge you extra any time they want to.<br><br>Nothing works, the staff hates you, and trees notwithstanding, the buildings are junky and loud.

Resident
1995 - 2004 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/10/2004
Changes managers frequently. The last couple of managers let too many shady characters in. The 1st 4 years or so we were there, it was nice. The buildings have become run down in the last 3 or 4 years, though. Maintainance used to be top-knotch, now it's like having the 3 stooges repair things, all the good maintainance guys left a few years ago. 1st repair call gets you a crappy "jerry-rig" that never works, hoping that will be the end of your annoying them, (They really do seem annoyed that they have to come fix things) 2nd or 3rd call will get you a real fix where they actually bother to order and/or salvage repair parts from empty units to do something at least somewhat more effective. I was told by an outside electrician that had to come to fix something for us that the electrical wiring in these units are DANGEROUS, the whole complex needs to be totally rewired desperately. We have had way too many electrical items/appliances, etc, die on us while here. Running the hair dryer or a space heater knocks out a room or two's worth of circuit breakers sometimes. There is also a lot of hidden/covered up mold in apartments, espescially on lower floor units. They clean hallways with LEAF BLOWERS. (which just pushes filth to the end of hallways or the bottom of stairwells, and leaves a sickening long-lingering gasoline smell.) The buildings are getting run down looking, the gutters are in disrepair, the woodwork looks atrocious. Nails stick up out of loose steps, and paint is liberally flaking off the handrails. Don't bring your family here, lots of "shack up" guests on the weekends make the parking lots unbearable. W.E. is a big heap of uncorrected problems covered with numerous band-aids, and a big happy smiley face in the form of the office to make you think it's "A great way of living at Wood's Edge". If you need a place to stay for a short time, it's so-so, but if you're looking for a home, keep driving right on past Wood's Edge, it's not worth the hassle. I wish to remain anonymous because I don't want them trying to hurt my credit/rental history, but I can answer questions anonymously from the email address tenchi@uymail.com

Leasing

Welcome home to Woods Edge, a newly remodeled community featuring one and two-bedroom apartment homes. Spacious, open floorplans give way to soaring nine-foot ceilings and private screened porches or sunrooms perfect for enjoying every season. Settle down in front of a roaring wood-burning fireplace, or enjoy a quick meal at your convenient breakfast bar before heading out to work. Blow off steam at the tennis, volleyball or basketball court, or soak in the sun next to the gleaming swimming pool. At Woods Edge, everything you love is within reach. Location is everything, and at Woods Edge, you'll be walking distance to schools, businesses, restaurants and shopping, including the Streets at Southpoint, RTP, Duke and UNC Chapel Hill. Plus, your commute is a breeze with easy access to I-40, I-540, and Highways 751, 54 & 55.

Management Company: Pegasus Residential*
